channel.title: Babylon Burning
channel.description: <p>Babylon Burning specializes in reggae music, new and old - from the rocksteady of the late 60s, through the roots and rockers era of the 70s, to the foundation dancehall sounds of the early 80s, right up to the freshest releases from Jamaica and around the world.</p>

item.title: hell a go pop
item.description: <p><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:aptos,aptos_embeddedfont,aptos_msfontservice,calibri,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:12pt">Featuring the riddim <em>Hell A Go Pop</em> from Irie Ites, and classic reggae riddims <em>None A Jah Jah Children</em> and <em>Promised Land</em>; Johnny Osbourne's new album <em>Universal Love Showcase</em>; new tunes from Cheizdek, Randy Valentine, Kimeco, Roe Summerz &amp; Boostive; and the usual foundation classics. </span></p>
item.author: Jesse I

item.title: higher life
item.description: <p><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:aptos,aptos_embeddedfont,aptos_msfontservice,calibri,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:12pt">Featuring the High Peak riddim from Oneness Records; the Tampa riddim from Paris La Mont; new tunes from Micah Shemaiah, Dre Island, Royal Blu, Willi Williams, Marcus I, Ka$e, Anthony B &amp; Johnny Osbourne; and a spotlight on Kranium ahead of his Melbourne show next week.</span></p>
item.author: Jesse I

item.title: don't give up on love
item.description: <p><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:aptos,aptos_embeddedfont,aptos_msfontservice,calibri,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:12pt">Featuring an interview with dancehall star Kranium, plus the Africa Works riddim from Giddimani Records, and new music from Keznamdi, Dahvid Slur, Stephen Marley and Mike Love, plus the usual throwback classics.</span></p>
item.author: Jesse I

item.title: lion heart
item.description: <p><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:aptos,aptos_embeddedfont,aptos_msfontservice,calibri,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:12pt">Revisiting Penthouse's classic General riddim, with new cuts from Romain Virgo, RC and Exco Levi; new herb tunes from Mesh Marina, Akae Beka &amp; Ras Attitude; new dancehall from Busy Signal and Major Lazer; the Marshall riddim from Hits 38 &amp; Jammys; and the usual roots and rocksteady classics.</span></p>
item.author: Jesse I

item.title: live from the Collingwood Yards courtyard
item.description: <p><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:aptos,aptos_embeddedfont,aptos_msfontservice,calibri,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:12pt">A special outside broadcast of Babylon Burning from the courtyard of the Collingwood Yards as part of the Stay Soft market, featuring guest sets from Bellyas and DJ Outsider. Plus the long-awaited new Chronixx album <em>Exile</em>, and new tunes from Alborosie and Vybz Kartel.</span></p>
item.author: Jesse I

item.title: keep on rising
item.description: <p><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:aptos,aptos_embeddedfont,aptos_msfontservice,calibri,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:12pt">Featuring more from the new Chronixx album <em>Exile</em>; new tunes from Alborosie, Micah Shemaiah, and Medisun; the <em>Golden Hour </em>riddim from Bambino Musik; and revisiting the <em>Nylon</em> riddim from Juke Boxx productions by special request.</span></p>
item.author: Jesse I

item.title: weather the storm
item.description: <p><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:aptos,aptos_embeddedfont,aptos_msfontservice,calibri,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:12pt">Paying respects to the late singer Vivian Jones (1957-2025), and legendary Jamaican broadcaster Barry G (1955-2025). Also featuring a heap of Echo Minott ahead of his Melbourne show, and new music from the likes of Skygrass, Busy Signal, Buju Banton, Bounty Killer, Naomi Cowan, Ka$e, Hector Roots Lewis, Ras Teo, Iotosh, Inna Vision &amp; Ini Kamoze.</span></p>
item.author: Jesse I

item.title: after the storm
item.description: <p>Featuring the <em>Scotch</em> riddim from Treydrumz &amp; BlakYaad Productions, and new music from Chronixx, Alborosie, Eesah, Bugle, Agent Sasco, and more...</p>
item.author: Jesse I

item.title: Babylon Burning presented by Lloyd Briggs
item.author: Jesse I

item.title: play skillfully
item.description: <p>Featuring new music from Perfect Giddimani, Chronixx, Jahzara, Roe Summerz, Rik Jam, Roberto Sanchez, Popcaan and nuff more... plus the usual vintage classics in the first hour.</p>
item.author: Jesse I
